intro: Thalictrum bissellii, commonly known as the western meadow rue, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in early summer. Its botanical features include a taproot system and fibrous roots, which help it thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Thalictrum bissellii is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it plays a role in supporting local wildlife.
